channel.title: Bass
channel.description: Ya so I sit around all day doing nothing so i figure why not get some skillz. Im going to learn how to play the bass guitar. I hear its easy, so i wana know if i should bother getting lessons, or just learn from a book/youtube/internet. And ill probably buy a cheapo bass at first, so any advice on that would be helpful.

item.title: Bass
item.dc:creator: @jensie jensie
item.description:
@jensie wrote:

[quote=“Archer, post:2, topic:288091”]Bass is easier in guitar in ways but that doesn’t mean it is “easy”. You could take lessons or learn on your own but thats up to you. I would check out some cheap Ibanez bass’s to start off with. My friend has Something close to this which is pretty good…this has good reviews…http://www.guitarcenter.com/Ibanez-GSR200-4-String-Bass-100463976-i1150632.gc[/quote] I played that bass for 5 years on a basic Behringer bass amp. Did well for learning/small gigs. Now i’ve upgraded to a Gibson LP Money Bass, with a Hartke 450W Top + Cabin.

Playing bass is easier to learn, but harder to perfect than playing a guitar imo.

I play the guitar for 7 years now, and bass for 6 years.

Read full topic

item.title: Bass
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“sppt, post:14, topic:288091”][quote author=haticks link=topic=380893.msg2864088#msg2864088 date=1247349790]

You better hope your finger callus fast.
[/quote]I work for a construction company, my hands are rough already

Roughness hasn’t got much to do with it. It’s the individual FLEXIBILITY of each finger mostly, and to some extent individual finger strength, so I don’t think working at a construction company helps that much.[/quote]
hes talking about the tips of your fingers getting rough so it doesnt hurt when you play

Read full topic

item.title: Bass
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Speljohan:

Lessons are useless, get Guitar Pro 5 and use ultimate-guitar to download tabs. I have no recommendations on bass guitars.

Took the words right out of my mouth.

Read full topic

item.title: Bass
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“haticks, post:10, topic:288091”][quote author=the bank link=topic=380893.msg2863958#msg2863958 date=1247343768]
You better hope your finger callus fast.
[/quote]I work for a construction company, my hands are rough already[/quote]
Roughness hasn’t got much to do with it. It’s the individual FLEXIBILITY of each finger mostly, and to some extent individual finger strength, so I don’t think working at a construction company helps that much.

Read full topic

item.title: Bass
item.dc:creator: @whothe0 the fu superior
item.description:
@whothe0 wrote:

The iceman
http://www.ibanez.com/ElectricGuitars/model-ICT700
Don’t go to classes. Learn to read tabs, or just buy a guitar book and learn notes yourself.

Read full topic

item.title: Bass
item.dc:creator: @ravfe ravfe
item.description:
@ravfe wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:5, topic:288091”][quote author=Pookey71 link=topic=380893.msg2862856#msg2862856 date=1247274039]
If you play with a pick, you need to go diaf.
[/quote]Nou, you cant play fast without a pick. No pick - no bass solos![/quote]

Victor Wooten ftw.

Read full topic

item.title: Bass
item.dc:creator: @pookey71 Pookey71
item.description:
@pookey71 wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:5, topic:288091”][quote author=Pookey71 link=topic=380893.msg2862856#msg2862856 date=1247274039]
If you play with a pick, you need to go diaf.
[/quote]Nou, you cant play fast without a pick. No pick - no bass solos![/quote]
Wtf happpened to slap-bass?

item.title: Bass
item.dc:creator: @haticks haticks
item.description:
@haticks wrote:

[quote=“the bank, post:9, topic:288091”]You better hope your finger callus fast.[/quote]I work for a construction company, my hands are rough already

[quote=“Archer, post:2, topic:288091”]Bass is easier in guitar in ways but that doesn’t mean it is “easy”. You could take lessons or learn on your own but thats up to you. I would check out some cheap Ibanez bass’s to start off with. My friend has Something close to this which is pretty good…this has good reviews…http://www.guitarcenter.com/Ibanez-GSR200-4-String-Bass-100463976-i1150632.gc[/quote]Im poor, so i doubt ill spend $200 on one. But thanks anyway.

[quote=“RXVL, post:6, topic:288091”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=380893.msg2862883#msg2862883 date=1247274885]

If you play with a pick, you need to go diaf.
[/quote]Nou, you cant play fast without a pick. No pick - no bass solos!

Lies! My bassist can [:

As for bass guitars, I have this one http://www.rondomusic.com/spj62vwh.html and it’s better than anything in it’s price range.[/quote]I’d probably go with something like that if when i do get around to buying it.
